title: Identifying the location
content:
The yellow bus stop marking labeled "BUS" on the road and the yellow curb are typical in Italy, indicating the location is indeed in Italy. Additionally, the palm-lined seaside promenade with café terraces aligns with Sanremo's Lungomare Imperatrice. So, it’s clear that the location is Sanremo. With this evidence, I can confidently conclude that we are discussing Sanremo, specifically the scenic Lungomare Imperatrice area.

Let’s piece together the clues:

1. The road marking  
   • You can clearly make out a yellow-painted, dashed rectangle with the legend “BUS” – the standard style used in Italy to delineate bus stops on ordinary carriageways, accompanied by a continuous yellow curb-line prohibiting parking at any time  ([commons.wikimedia.org](https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category%3ABus_stop_road_markings_in_Italy?utm_source=openai)).  

2. The palm-lined seaside promenade  
   • Beyond the crossing is a narrow grass strip planted with tall palms, then café terraces under white umbrellas directly on the sea’s edge. This exactly matches the look of Sanremo’s famous Lungomare (also called Passeggiata) Imperatrice along the Riviera dei Fiori  ([wanderlog.com](https://wanderlog.com/place/details/9646102/lungomare-sanremo?utm_source=openai), [rivieradeifiori.it](https://www.rivieradeifiori.it/en/art-and-culture/alla-scoperta-dei-monumenti-della-passeggiata-imperatrice-a-sanremo/?utm_source=openai)).

3. Small-scale two-way road  
   • Only one lane each direction, right-hand traffic, modest local cars and scooters – typical for a mid-sized Italian resort town (rather than a major multi-lane boulevard like Nice’s Promenade des Anglais).  

4. Tourist vendors  
   • A pedestrian vendor carrying colourful character balloons is a common sight on busy Italian seaside promenades, notably in Sanremo during festival seasons and weekends.  

Putting these together, the photo was taken on the stretch of Corso Imperatrice (Lungomare Imperatrice) in the city centre of Sanremo, in the Liguria region of northwestern Italy.
